website_summaries.verdict: The EA6400 is a fine router. What it may lack in performance against other 11ac routers in 11ac mode, it makes for in a sharp interface, easy setup and feature set. It's just that it's not a significantly different router from the EA6500 we saw last year.
cons: Minor glitch deleting file on attached external drive
Slower at 5GHz than last year's EA6500

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Rubbish. Had trouble configuring the device and couldn't log in to set it up. Contacted Linksys technical support, who said the device was out of warranty, even though I'd only just bought it. After persuasion, they agreed to provide support. It turned out there was a firmware defect which required downloading a firmware upgrade, then installation. Didn't like the idea of doing firmware upgrade on a new product. Should have sent it back. As it is, it's just sitting in the cupboard and never been used.
customer_reviews.author: Mr L.

customer_reviews.title: Not good enough for the price
customer_reviews.text: After being fed with Virgin media not so super hub I decided for to buy this router by during set up it kept giving me a Error 101 so I contacted the highly trained monkeys at linksys technical support who aren't very technical after hours they could not fully resolve the problem and it kept doing it after a few days. So after some googling I found out it was a problem with old firmware so I flashed the newest available which fixed that error but the wifi was still weak when I was a few meters away. So i decided to return. Also to set up the Linksys smart wifi app I had factory reset the router!
customer_reviews.author: Top Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: good at what it does but rubbish documentation
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to use this as an access point at the end of a powerline pair so I could improve the wifi at the top of the house. This I eventually managed to do and it works well. 3 stars because Linksys insist on controlling how you set it up, (in the name of "a better customer experience"), and don't supply the IP address or the user name and password on the router or in any of the enclosed documents. I wasted sooooo much time before I eventually managed to find it on their website. (Note: Make sure you change the default password as it is common for EA6300, possibly all of their routers).
customer_reviews.author: crh

customer_reviews.title: Gathering dust
customer_reviews.text: This was a total pain to use, so has been resigned to a cupboard until I can foist it off on someone else; I didn't keep the packaging so can't return it. I already have a DHCP server on my network, so disabled DHCP and NAT on the device. Those setting seem to be ignored and DHCP wouldn't actually turn off. Also, the validation of subnets is terrible; I use /23s but it only accepts /24s. In essence, this may be an okay device if you're planning to replace all of your current devices, but just doesn't want to play ball if you're trying to integrate it into your current network
customer_reviews.author: Steeevieee

customer_reviews.title: This device is excellent, ONCE YOU'VE MANUALLY UPDATED THE FIRMWARE TO THE ...
customer_reviews.text: This device is excellent, ONCE YOU'VE MANUALLY UPDATED THE FIRMWARE TO THE LATEST VERSION! Unless you do this (it won't happen automatically, no matter what the settings say), it has patchy performance and a buggy setup. Since updating the firmware, however, the performance has been consistently excellent. You can update the firmware using the manufacturer's website (just do an internet search to find what you need).
customer_reviews.author: sine Llama non

customer_reviews.title: Not fit for purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Not fit for purpose. Day 1 I love it. but within a week the DNS server was confused, and there is NO alternative to the web interface, and the web interface is not good enough to cover cases where, with my old Thompson box, I could telnet in and poke around. To only have a graphical front end, the front end must cover all important issues, and this one doesn't. I'm about to contact Amazon re returns.
customer_reviews.author: John Allsup

customer_reviews.title: This one is easy to set-up and has more functions
customer_reviews.text: I've replaced an old Linksys model with this one. This one is easy to set-up and has more functions, most of them useful. The signal strength is also better. Basically it gets the job done and works as expected. The minus - it is bigger than the older model and the adapter is bigger as well. My router stays in a service location in a box inside the wall and it was hard to fit this one inside. But is it a good looking device so it is also OK to place it on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Anton Dragomanov

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade from previous model.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Linksys E4200 which was playing up. It is certainly more effective in the same location...I am pleased with the purchase. I haven't plucked up the courage to investigate it's full potential...but I'm sure there are some out there who will have endless hours of fun with it!
customer_reviews.author: Colin Mustoe

customer_reviews.title: Worst router I have ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an IT Engineer and have used 100's of routers and this is by far the worst I have ever used. Wifi range is terrible even in a small 3 bed house with thin walls. Parental controls are a joke. all you can do id block time of day and manual websites. static DNS is broken. I tried to setup open DNS and it only works intermittently. Randomly allowing my kids to view anything they want. After searching the linksys forums and seeing the numerous complains about this I decided it is time for a refund. My next purchase will not be a linksys.
customer_reviews.author: SimonFleming

customer_reviews.title: No good for open source / 3rd party firmwares
customer_reviews.text: Good little router - but dont buy it if Open Source is your goal. Unfortunately not much (if anything) available for the SoC used in this one. I returned mine an WRT1900 from same manufacture. Not that IS an awesome hobbyists router :-)
customer_reviews.author: nsk1974

customer_reviews.title: I've now sold it and got a apple one which is much better and I'm able to pick up a signal where ...
customer_reviews.text: Average distance for a quality ac wifi unit. I've now sold it and got a apple one which is much better and I'm able to pick up a signal where this one couldn't reach.
customer_reviews.author: Daz

customer_reviews.title: Just works - and really well
customer_reviews.text: So simple to setup So much faster than my previous 'free' TalkTalk supplied router Great for multi-media devices (Apple TV, Samsung Smart TV, Samsung BlueRay,Yamaha AV Amp)
customer_reviews.author: Dr. L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Amazing router. Negatives
customer_reviews.text: Amazing router. Negatives: The 5G is very weak mind you, but this is expected. A bit finicky with USB mass storage. Only supports DynDNS, no frees (no-ip etc).
customer_reviews.author: otheos

customer_reviews.title: sporadic disconnection
customer_reviews.text: very poor device - this is 2nd replacement and still it keeps disconnecting Have spoken to Linksys customer support (router) and Intel customer (NIC) and we were not able to resolve the issues
customer_reviews.author: Mark J

customer_reviews.title: ... from Linksys tech support mainly because i am not good at these things
customer_reviews.text: So far i am highly impressed with this router once i was able to get it running with a little help from Linksys tech support mainly because i am not good at these things. So far this router has not missed a beat.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: Works good in my office - good signal strength on both bands.
customer_reviews.author: stsoftware

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product, many features over and above your normal rourter
customer_reviews.author: JJ O.

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but Wifi range isn't sufficient
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is pretty good, unfortunately the Wifi range isn't sufficient enough although my house is not considered problematic for Wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Lior B.

customer_reviews.title: wasted money for no thing.
customer_reviews.text: very bad in covering areas, low speed, interrupting the network. the worst router i dealed with, do not wast your money.
customer_reviews.author: Hamed Kamel M. Awad

customer_reviews.title: reliable and easy to configure router
customer_reviews.text: Fast,reliable and easy to configure router! Certainty worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The new dual core cpu provides a significant jump in ...
customer_reviews.text: The new dual core cpu provides a significant jump in performance allowing advanced functions e.g. openvpn. The stock firmware is ok but only offers basic functions. luckily there are beta builds of the ddwrt firmware which allow the full potential of the router to be realized. Instructions on flashing ddwrt can be found here:
customer_reviews.author: sceptic

customer_reviews.title: Useless WiFi.
customer_reviews.text: Awful wireless, worse than the VM SH2 it was going to replace. Second hand device sent to me, so sent it back when I realised is didn't work as it should and it was pre-used.
customer_reviews.author: Mr F.

customer_reviews.title: Linksys EA6700
customer_reviews.text: Well what can I say... CRAP... When it works it's blistering fast but then it drops out all the time... Range... no different to any other router I've ever had... Apps you have to buy!!! to do additional naff things Try getting access to your HP printer for scanning No.... Your 4Tb Synology NAS server.. no chance... Try a Kingston or SanDisk USB to add storage on the USB 2 or 3... naw you're havin a laugh! But the interface is really pretty.. so what! Any sign of a hardware update... not likely there's a new model out now... Oh and Linksys was sold to belkin.... Support... spend hours through the forum as there's no other realistic alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkle Designs

customer_reviews.title: Does nothing any better than my previous router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading positive reviews of other wireless routers in the Linksys range so that this could replace my BT Home Hub 3 (non UK users - this is the free router provided from BT for their up to 70Mb/s DSL service). The wireless performance had no further reach than the HH and the speed was far slower. On the same channel and in the same place the HH achieves around 5.5MB/s transfer from my NAS, the netgear struggled to hit 1.5MB/s. Sending back after a days testing.
customer_reviews.author: Will M

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic piece of Kit!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my Netgear WNDR3700 which has recently kept on dropping wifi connections. I am definitely impressed with the improved range and throuhput on this one, expecially on the 5GHz band. Can safely say the wifi signal reaches everywhere in my 3-story house with no more than one or two bars drop in connection strength. Drop one star as I would have to agree with previous reviews saying the setup can be cumbersome, it seems the overly simplified setup software built into the router is prone to crashing - I had to do a factory reset and was able to complete set up the second time around. Once setup, this router is definitely top notch though!
customer_reviews.author: Scoutsiraj

customer_reviews.title: Smart and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Unit looks good which is important I guess if you have it visible. Set up is very simple and to be honest the range, although criticised elsewhere I found to be fine. There are cheaper units out there (hence the loss of a star) but you are getting the comfort of Linksys branding and support. In short if you want a middle range WiFi router you could do a lot worse than this unit. chrislrevieweramazon@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Router
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router now for several months. It is Awesome. It's very fast, and even handles our house that has 4 Computers, everyone with a smartphone, tablets and TV connection. It was great when my son was doing exams, as even from work I could ensure his xbox wasn't online. (He wasn't overly joyed about that ability). Also the prioritisation function is so easy to use from either your own PC or Smartphone. Would highly recommend this in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Ciaran Murphy

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! Purchased this router to replace my old linksys that died. Set up was fairly easy, but I keep losing connections to all my wireless devices. Range is very poor. You practically have to sit on top of the router which defeats the point of being wireless. Spend a lot of time with technical help. Each time I was assured that my problems were fixed. They weren't. I have wireless security cameras and they go in and out constantly. Needless to say, this router is being returned. Always been a fan of Linksys but not anymore....
customer_reviews.author: JennaM4

customer_reviews.title: Solved one problem, caused lots of others.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to solve a slow network connection with my MacBook pro, which it did perfectly. Interface initially erratic and annoying. Wireless signal not as good as my free router from Plusnet. Spent MANY hours trying to connect an XBox 360 with no joy, including conversations with XBox support and Linksys. Returned and will buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: David Robins

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Connections could last more than a few minutes before resetting. Like some other reviews, wasted another half hour connecting a usb drive. nothing in the user interface - not even a failure to see the drive message. Returned and money refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. F. W. Allan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far this machine has gone in easily and is functioning well. Very happy camper
customer_reviews.author: LondonSingist

customer_reviews.title: worse than my old TP Link
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old TP Link that I used hoping that it would provide better coverage in my entire house and faster connection. Strangely it is the opposite. This router has worse coverage than the old TP Link router.
customer_reviews.author: Damian

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive. Doesn't met expectations.
customer_reviews.text: The GUI of Cisco Linksys too slow. There is no advanced options like SNMP protocol. Too expensive. Does not met expectations
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

product_meta.title: EA6400-UK
product_meta.description: Linksys EA6400 Video Enthusiast AC1600 Smart wifi Router - EA6400-UK

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars13 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
